fields.description:
Users sometimes may start using Pipelines without the knowledge of the workspace owner, which may cause unexpected costs.

This feature request is to add the ability to disable Pipelines for an entire workspace, allowing only admins to re-enable it.
fields.summary: Ability to disable Pipelines on a workspace level

fields.description:
{panel:title=Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
 At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
 You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Breadcrumb in Pipelines refers to the old Workspace name.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a repository with Pipelines
 # Change the workspace name at [https://bitbucket.org/account/workspaces/]
 # Verify the workspace name at the breadcrumb in Pipelines

h3. Expected Results

All the breadcrumbs retrieve the latest Workspace name.
h3. Actual Results

Breadcrumb in Pipelines refers to the outdated Workspace name. 
h3. Workaround

If the problem is happening in a personal workspace, you can change it by following the next steps:
 * Access *Personal settings*
 * Click in *Atlassian account*
 * You will be redirected to [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility]
 * Click on change your full name
 * Update the Pipelines page and the breadcrumb will be updated.

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior in a shared workspace.

Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. In that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Breadcrumb in Pipelines doesn't respect the Workspace name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When viewing diff of a file in pull request unified view, a line of code is missing from the view. However, it looks normal in side-by-side diff view and in "View entire file" view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ignore whitespace *on* - Open the file in unified view with this option "Ignore whitespace" set to on. the behavior is normal. 
 # Ignore whitespace *on* + View Entire File - normal

 # Ignore whitespace *off* + View Entire File - normal

 # Ignore whitespace *off* - rendered diff missing a line in the file. 

h3. Expected Results

The file should show diff normally even with "Ignore whitespace off "
h3. Actual Results
 # Ignore whitespace *off* - rendered diff missing a line in the file. 

h3. Workaround

View the diff using either of the below options set:
 * Ignore whitespace *on* 

 * Ignore whitespace *on* + View Entire File 

 * Ignore whitespace *off* + View Entire File
fields.summary: Diff in the Pull Request breaks when viewing the file in unified view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Loading next pages in "commits" view will remove any branch filtering

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Commits view
# Click "Next" to see second page of commits
# Select branch "develop" from dropdown. Second page of commits is shown, but branch filtering is not applied - I can see commits belong to master, bugfix branches etc
# Hit refresh (F5). Second page of commits from develop is loaded, but commit tree graphic is not rendered.

h3. Expected Results
# The branches and graphs are rendered correctly

h3. Actual Results

# Branch filtering is not applied
# Second page of commits from develop is loaded, but commit tree graphic is not rendered.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Loading next pages in "commits" view will remove any branch filtering

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding more than 10 SSH key in Access-keys will only show the latest 10 keys
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to repositories access-key
 # Add more than 11 keys

h3. Expected Results
It should show all the list of the available keys added to the repositories
h3. Actual Results
It will only show the latest 10 keys the old key won't be in the list


h3. Workaround
Access the following endpoint to get all the access keys added to the repository
{code}
https://bitbucket.org/!api/2.0/repositories/<WorkspaceID>/<RepoName>/deploy-keys?pagelen=50
{code}
(i) Pleased do update `<WorkspaceID>` and `<RepoName>`
fields.summary: Adding more than 10 SSH key in Access-keys will only show the latest 10 keys

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When in a new repository, you'd want to enable Pipelines / Deployments you will have to commit the bitbucket-pipelines.yml config file. However, with branch permissions enabled, it shows the error 500 instead of a proper error message. 

This can be reproduced with if the user committing does not have permission to the repository's main branch (default is "master")

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a new repository or a repository where pipelines is not enabled :
#* Enable branch permissions where you don't have permission to write to the main branch
# Navigate to the Pipelines tab / Deployments tab to enable it. It will ask for you to commit the configuration file to your main branch - Click Commit
# You'll see the error 500 

h3. Expected Results
* An error message stating that you don't have permission to commit to the main branch

h3. Actual Results
* Error 500 shown in the Web UI.

h3. Workaround
# Request your Team Administrator to give you permission to write on the main branch
# OR you can request the administrator to make the change for you (if the admin has the right permissions to write to the main branch.)
fields.summary: Improve Error Message when Enabling Deployments with Branch permissions enabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In case a user installs the Bitbucket Cloud Trello Power-ups add-on, the user is getting rate limited (429) due to the number of API calls
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Bitbucket Cloud Trello Power-ups add-on

h3. Expected Results

User is not getting rate limited
h3. Actual Results

The user is getting rate limited
h3. Workaround

Disable BB powerup in Trello or not keeping Trello UI open for a long period of time
fields.summary: Bitbucket Cloud Trello Power-ups is rate limiting the users due to heavy numbers of calls

fields.description:
Very often, I type a comment on a line in a PR, I try to click OK, but miss the button and click cancel and as a result I have to type everything all over again (which is very annoying when you just typed a long message).

It would be nice if there was a confirmation popup when you click cancel when there is text in the text box.
fields.summary: Add confirmation to comment dialog in PR when text is present

fields.description:
At the moment, while editing a JIRA issue from the link in a pull request in Bitbucket, doesn't show any pop-up screen if there are fields to be filled while transitioning the issue and thereby will not allow issue transition.

Steps to reproduce:
 1. Open any PR which is linked to the JIRA issue, for example via PR title.
 2. Click on the JIRA issue link from Bitbucket PR
 3. A pop-up opens the issue in the same tab as a PR, and we can transition the issue to a different status. 
 4. Configure issue screen for a transition in JIRA where users have to fill out some fields

Expected:
 the issue is transitioned successfully

Actual result:
!image-2020-09-11-16-15-46-335.png|width=360,height=210!
fields.summary: Allow editing JIRA issues while transitioning an issue from a pull request in Bitbucket

fields.description:
For example, the repo name is `user-management-service`. In VS Code, it's possible to find the repo by typing `ums`.

 

In Bitbucket that is not possible, it gives no search results.
fields.summary: Improve search functionallity for repos

fields.description:
Currently, in very large PRs, it's possible that the auto-generated PR description goes over 2k characters.

This feature request is to add a button in the settings page to stop this from happening.

The reasoning for this is that PR descriptions larger than 2k characters break the PR, not allowing it to be merged. See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BCLOUD-19156

The suggestion here would be for the button to either stop the PR from generating any description or for it to only allow the description to have up to 2000 characters in order to prevent the PR from being unmergeable.
fields.summary: Add a button to stop the auto-generated PR description from going over 2k characters

fields.description:
Most other views have already been updates to be more interactive, but the commits view (despite having a tab title that didn't even indicate, you're viewing commits) seems to be plain old, nothing more than {{git log}}. Just like the issue navigator there could be certain filters:
 * user
 * date
 * repository
 * branch (also branch prefix)
 * issue
 * pull request
 * project

Paging could be either endless scrolling, by date, variable entry amount (10, 20, 50, 100, 200).
 * etc.
fields.summary: Filters for Bitbucket commits view

fields.description: It would be very nice to have an overall activity log for all Atlassian activities which you can filter. So all your work is in one place and you can better understand, what you've done as a whole over different projects and Atlassian apps.
fields.summary: Activity log

fields.description:
Currently, the user is unable to re-invite the user directly from the group's tab, the user will have to click inside the group to click the (Resend invitation).

It would be great to have a list of not invited users in the group's tab so the user can monitor or re-invite.
fields.summary: Ability to re-invite the user in groups tab

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When changing the "Main branch" information of the repository, the branch page information for the new "Main branch" does not reflect automatically.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the repository settings
 # Click on Advance and change the "Main Branch" of the repository
 # Click on the back button at the top left of the page and you will be redirected to the Source page (note the new main branch is displayed correctly)
 # Click on the Branch tab (note the old "Main branch" is still visible)

h3. Expected Results
The new "Main branch" would be visible automatically.
h3. Actual Results
The old "Main branch" is still visible.

h3. Workaround

It is required to access any branch within Branch page which will lead to correcting the branch setup.
fields.summary: Setting a new main branch on repository settings does not change the branch immediately

fields.description:
Whenever creating a PR that has a description longer than 2000 characters, when attempting to merge it, the PR will end up returning a 500 error instead of actually merging the PR.

While this is a limitation with the PR, this feature request is to add the ability to merge PRs that have descriptions longer than 2000 characters.

The workaround for this is to reduce the size of the description.
fields.summary: Allow PR descriptions to be larger than 2k characters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Pipelines fail to report indentation error in the "aws" section in bitbucket-pipelines.yml
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try editing +bitbucket-pipelines.yml+
 # Add:

{code:java}
image: 
   name: 034534534535.ecr.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/dev/ecr:v4 
aws: 
      access-key: $ECR_ACCESS_KEY 
      secret-key: $ECR_SECRET_KEY
{code}

 # No errors reported, this indeed fails the image pull with 403.

h3. Expected Results

Bitbucket pipelines validator should catch this.
h3. Actual Results

Bitbucket pipelines validator doesn't catch this, 

Correct YAML syntax as per official documentation:
{code:java}
image:
  name: <aws_account_id>.dkr.ecr.<region>.amazonaws.com/openjdk:8
  aws: 
    access-key: $AWS_ACCESS_KEY
    secret-key: $AWS_SECRET_KEY
{code}
h3. Workaround

Referring to the documentation.
fields.summary: Pipelines fails to validate indentation error in "aws" section in YAML

fields.description: There is no color distinction on the sidebar for the left icons and the main items on Bitbucket/dashboard/repositories page. It would make more sense design wise to have a little distinction there...here is a [screenshot|https://imgur.com/aPwZ9X3] of what I'm referring to.
fields.summary: sidebar needs accent color

fields.description:
In pipelines, we now have condition changesets.includePaths

 

A step can run if the path matches. But the step has no idea which path is being matched.

It would be really helpful to have a keyword defined against each path and have it available in the ENV. Something like regex capture group.

 

For example, a monorepo wtih top level directories corresponding to different services. This will allow us to write something like this* and let the running step know which service to build/test/deploy.

 

```

{color:#f07178}condition{color}{color:#89ddff}:
{color}  {color:#f07178}changesets{color}{color:#89ddff}:
{color}    {color:#f07178}includePaths{color}{color:#89ddff}:
{color}{color:#89ddff}      - {color}{color:#c3e88d}"\{user}/**"{color}

```

 

In the step, something like ${BITBUCKET_CHANGESETS_PATH_CAPTURE_GROUP} which can have the value `user`.

 

This way, we can reuse the same stepdifinition for all services instead of coy pasting over and over again.
fields.summary: Condition -> Changesets should allow a custom variable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Assume that you have a JIRA workspace integrated with a JIRA Cloud instance, and in one of the workspace's repos you enable the option "Require issue keys in commit messages".

If you transfer this repository to a different workspace that doesn't have an integration with JIRA, then this option remains enabled and it is not possible to deselect it.

Additionally, it is not possible to push new commits, either with or without an issue key in their message.
 The error that is shown is "The commit message does not contain a valid issue key."
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate a Bitbucket workspace with a JIRA Cloud instance
 # Enable the option "Require issue keys in commit messages" in one of the repos owned by this workspace
 # Transfer the repository to a different workspace that doesn't have a JIRA Cloud integration
 # Accept the transfer request

h3. Expected Results

The "Require issue keys in commit messages" option remains editable, and the user can enable/disable it.
h3. Actual Results

The "Require issue keys in commit messages" option is not editable, it remains selected and the user cannot disable it.
 Additionally, if the user tries to push to the repository, new commits are not accepted with the error "The commit message does not contain a valid issue key.", even if the commit messages contain an issue key. (I believe this is due to the fact that there are no links in this repository)
h3. Workaround

1. If a user integrates the workspace that the repo is transferred to with the same JIRA Cloud instance, then it is possible to edit the "Require issue keys in commit messages" option.

2. As an alternative, the user can inspect the page with e.g. Developer Tools in Chrome, inspect the button, and then remove the word "disabled" from the HTML code. This will allow the user to deselect the option.
fields.summary: Transfering ownership of a repo with the option "Require issue keys in commit messages", results in the option not being editable when the target workspace doesn't have a JIRA integration
Specify destination branch when opening a new pull request

fields.description:
Currently, admin users will receive e-mail notifications for all repositories they administer for things such as Pipelines failed builds, regardless of whether they are watching the repository or not.

This feature request is to add the ability for admins to opt-out of e-mail notifications for repos they administer.
fields.summary: Allow admin users to opt-out of notifications on any given repository.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users with access to only one workspace are unable to create Project in UI

When users try to create a new project, enter all the information, click Create Project, nothing happens. No error message is given, it just fails silently.

This issue doesn't occur for users having access to more than one workspace and impact to those having access to only one workspace.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project
 # Enter all the information, click Create Project

h3. Expected Results
The project is created successfully

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens. No error message is given, it just fails silently.

h3. Workaround
Use the below API to create the project - 
{code:java}
curl -i -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" --user username:password https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/workspaces/{workspaceid}/projects -d '{"name": "test Project",  
    "key": "test",
    "description": "test description",
    "is_private": true
}'
{code}
fields.summary: Users with access to only one workspace are unable to create Project in UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Pending merges functionality is a recently added feature that allows users to automatically merge the PRs if their builds pass.
The problem, in this case, is that if you attempt to use this feature, and attempt to sync the Source branch into the destination branch when the PR will open, which will trigger new builds on the destination branch, the auto-merge functionality won't show up in the merge menu.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a branch permission that requires 1 or more builds to pass in the latest commit and allow auto-merging branches
 # Enable the "pending merges" feature on Bitbucket Labs
 # Create a new PR, ensure the source branch is ahead of the destination branch by at least one commit. 
 # Perform a branch sync from the source branch to the destination branch
 # Click the "Merge" button, you'll see the message "Must pass merge checks before merging" instead of allowing you to merge the PR automatically

h3. Expected Results
The button to automatically merge the PR shows up and allows you to merge the PR automatically once the builds are over.

h3. Actual Results
Clicking the "Merge" button, you'll see the message "Must pass merge checks before merging" instead of allowing you to automatically merge when the builds all pass

h3. Workaround
Reload the page. The button will show up as expected if you do so.
fields.summary: "Pending merges" does not shows up if the destination branch is synced with the source

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When an admin tries to remove the owner of a personal workspace through the "Users on Plan" page, they don't see any error message indicating that they can't remove this user from the workspace because the user is the owner of this workspace. 
Steps to reproduce: 
* In a personal workspace, go to Settings 
* Select Users on Plan 
* Click on the X to remove the owner of the personal workspace 
* You will be redirected to a pop-up saying "Remove access" 
* Click on Remove 
* Nothing happens

h3. Suggested Solution

When an admin tries to remove the owner of a personal workspace through the "Users on Plan" page, it should show an error message indicating that this user is the owner of this workspace and can't be removed
fields.summary: When an admin tries to remove the owner of a personal workspace, Bitbucket should show an error message indicating that the user is the owner and can't be removed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, we can't block a user in our workspace, so they can comment on or edit issues or pull requests in my public repositories. 

h3. Suggested Solution
As an admin, I would like to be able to block users from my workspace, so they can't comment on or edit issues or pull requests in my public repositories.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to be able to block users from my workspace

fields.description:
*Summary:*
Bitbucket cloud has toast notifications that greet the user at the time of login and is associated to the cookie. If the session cookie is cleared the pop-up shows up again and hence leading to a lot of frustration among users who clear cookies often or have the security feature turned on on their browser.

*Proposed Recommendations:*
Please consider using feature flags or non-cookie based approach towards notifications

*Workaround:*
- Disable the Strict Cookie settings on your browser security settings
(This is a Temporary workaround until we can get this addressed from the Bitbucket Cloud platform)
fields.summary: Bitbucket Cloud pop-up notifications don't go away

fields.description:
It would be nice to have Forensic Lucid added to the list of languages, one can choose for a repository. 
The referred list can be found at: repository > Settings > Repository details, and then Language-dropdown.
fields.summary: Add Forensic Lucid as repository language choice

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When removing reviewer from the PR (through UI and API) still send the notifications about the changes in PR to the reviewer  
h3. Steps to Reproduce

+Through the UI:+ 
 # Remove the reviewer of the Repository Settings > Default Reviewer

+Through the API:+

When  the reviewers are removed from the PR (removed them from the "reviewers" array as well as from the "participants" array) they would still be "watching" the PR, so even though they were not participants anymore, they would still get all the unwanted notifications"
h3. Expected Results

The expected result is the reviewer stops seeing the notifications
h3. Actual Results

The reviewers are receiving the notification, even after unwatch the PR
h3. Workaround
 * The customer can go themselves and unwatch the PR through UI
fields.summary: When removing reviewer from the PR (through UI and API) still send the notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

API support to unwatch the users from the Pull request
h3. Steps to Reproduce

We looked at the API documentation, and we couldn't find any API to unwatch the PR
h3. Expected Results

There should be an API to unwatch the users from Pull request
h3. Actual Results

There is no API to unwatch the users from Pull request
h3. Workaround
 
User has to manually unwatch the PR from UI ([bitbucket.org|http://bitbucket.org/])
fields.summary: Add API support to unwatch users from PR

fields.description: YAML configuration to allow installation of LFS on Pipelines step container by default
fields.summary: install LFS by default on Pipelines

fields.description:
At the moment, it is possible to set default reviewers for pull requests on a repo level.

Some users would like to be able to set this on the project level: this way all repos belonging to the project would have the same default reviewers.

This way users won't have to set the default reviewers in each repo, which can be time consuming if the number of repos is high.
fields.summary: Set default reviewers on the project level

fields.description:
Currently, it is not possible to create user SSH keys via OAuth token in v2 API. This was possible in v1 API. This feature is available in Github and Gitlab.

Question on CDAC - https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/create-user-ssh-keys/39662
fields.summary: Ability to create SSH keys via OAuth token in v2 API

fields.description:
Both github and gitlab, in addition to <workspace>.bitbucket.io, support per-<workspace>/<repository> subpages.

For instance, [https://googlechromelabs.github.io/serial-terminal/] was created from the repository [https://github.com/GoogleChromeLabs/serial-terminal] (see the branch gh-pages)
fields.summary: https://<workspace>.bitbucket.io/<repostory>

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user is an owner of a personal workspace, he is not able to add himself to a new or existing group within that workspace. And is presented with an error "Unable to add the user. To invite a new member, enter an email address"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a personal workspace, create a group or use existing group that you are not yet a part of
 # Try to add yourself to a new group, you will face the error specified above

h3. Expected Results

For the workspace owner to be able to add/remove himself from any group membership within their workspace
h3. Actual Results

User is presented with an error in the UI "Unable to add the user. To invite a new member, enter an email address" and if that same user tried to invite himself to that group , when trying to accept the invitation, he is presented with the error that he is already logged in as that user.
h3. Workaround

user is forced to having to add himself to each repo independently. And for branch restrictions, he needs to add himself to each permission in order to be able to merge a PR or being able to push code.
fields.summary: Owner of a workspace is not able to add himself to a new or existing group within a workspace

fields.description:
I think it will be highly valuable to be able to get the blob sha in the response of

GET /2.0/repositories/\{workspace}/\{repo_slug}/src/\{node}/\{path}&format=meta

Without this, the only way out is to get the full repo contents, to see its file states.

The file SHA provides an easy way for caller to maintain a local cache, reducing API calls.
fields.summary: Provide blob SHA of a given file

fields.description:
A fixed 10 items page size in endpoints like 

GET /2.0/repositories/\{workspace}/\{repo_slug}/src/\{node}/\{path}&format=meta

Seems very limited. My suggestion is a configurable paging in request.
fields.summary: Configurable paging

fields.description:
I want to be able to trigger my pipeline step with a specific variable. In my specific use case it is an environment variable vor maven. When Im in the Pipeline View and I habe 2 steps configured:
{noformat}
pipelines:
  pull-requests: 
    '**':
      - step:
          name: Pull Request
          caches:
            - maven
            - node
          script:
            - *do stuff.....*
      - step:
          name: Deploy artifacts to test environment
          deployment: deployment-env
          trigger: manual
          script:
            - atlas-package -D*variable*=true
      - step: 
          name: Deploy artifacts to test environment
          deployment: deployment-env
          trigger: manual
          script: 
            - atlas-package -D*variable*=false
  {noformat}
It isn't possible to have 2 Steps direct to the same Deployment ENV. Wouldn't it be nice, if I can define a variable when Im in the Pipeline view (right side are the logs and left details of the pipeline) when trigger is set to manual ? For sure I could got to Pipelines -> Run pipeline  and select everything I need, but I think its inconvenient and could lead to human error, when searching for the correct branch. Also I would be able to see visually when the step before deployment is green.

If u need any further explanations, feel free to contact me.
fields.summary: Being able to set a Variable in a non custom pipeline, when the trigger is manual

fields.description:
Currently it is not possible to distinguish projects with exact initial characters when choosing a project on repository creation project dropdown due to the name being trimmed.

Note that the same pattern does not apply when checking the project name in Project page or repository settings page dropdown for projects.

How it works in project page:
 !Screen Shot 2020-08-31 at 10.30.26.png|thumbnail! 

How it works in repository creation page:
 !Screen Shot 2020-08-31 at 10.30.58.png|thumbnail! 

It would be great either if the whole project name is displayed or if it's possible to see the full project name by hovering the mouse on it.
fields.summary: Project names with exact initial characters cannot be distinguished in the dropdown for repostory creation.

fields.description:
Currently, the "build failed" event can be configured only repository-wide.

This feature request is to have the ability to configure the "build failed" event at the branch level.

!image-2020-08-31-17-27-08-789.png|width=477,height=278!
fields.summary: Ability to configure "build failed" chat notification at the branch level.

fields.description:
*Issue Summary:*

The maximum size that can be accommodated on Bitbucket Cloud is 8GB which includes 1GB of build memory and 7GB for services. At the moment, we cannot scale this any higher.

Certain builds would require more memory than the capped maximum of 8GB. In such cases the customers cannot run the builds on pipelines for the below reasons:
- Build memory constraints
- Performance issues
- Additional build time & exceeds the time limit of 120 minutes

There are certain cases where post optimization the builds are innately large and would need to be accommodated which is currently a blocker for a few users.

*Workaround:*
Optimize the builds for better performance. But, we from Atlassian cannot aid guidelines for optimization and would need your system design/devops engineer to aid you with this.
fields.summary: Increase container & service memory limits / Allow scaling

fields.description:
Hello.

I'm a React developer, When opening my Bitbucket account I took a look at the redux dev tools, found the all App state is visible for any user who has a Redux dev tool, so this point could affect on the team privacy or the whole app security.
 
I suggest you hide the Redux state in the production mode, you can do it from the Redux store.
fields.summary: Redux state

fields.description:
Currently, we can only use steps entity to form YAML anchors.
* https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/yaml-anchors/

*Feature request:*
Aside from "step", it will also be useful to have "script" entity to form YAML anchors.
This will allow customers to re-use repetitive scripts to different steps.
fields.summary: Use script entity for YAML anchors

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Mercurial repositories have been deprecated but they are still visible in workspace. However, clicking them does nothing and spin runs forever
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View the workplace having the Mercurial repositories created earlier before it was unsupported
 # The user might see unsupported Mercurial repositories in the workspace

h3. Expected Results

Mercurial repositories should not be visible in the Workspace and would be deleted.
h3. Actual Results

Mercurial repositories are visible in Workspace
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. However, the user can ignore the Mercurial repositories until they are finally disappeared from the workspace
fields.summary: Deprecated Mercurial repositories are visible in Workspace

fields.description: A merged PR page should look 'more different' than a PR page that is pending. The pending state of the page doesn't remind me/draw my attention to the fact that this PR is pending. I often forget to click merge
fields.summary: Distinguish the merge button on merged PR pages

fields.description:
Bitbucket currently has branch permissions through which specific commit on a branch can be avoided, but there is no such feature where pushing of stale branches on a repository can be avoided.
* If the branches are deleted on the remote and not on local and if a developer execute git force push then all the stale branches are restored on the repositories which make the repo bulkier

To avoid/ease the cleaning process, Bitbucket should have a feature such as branch permissions which helps in filtering the stale branches when a force push is executed.
fields.summary: Branch permissions to restrict stale branches

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While setting up the "Mirror" functionality, Bitbucket does not allow/show personal workspaces as an option to perform this integration between Bitbucket Cloud and Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upgrade your Bitbucket "personal workspace" to the premium plan
# Go to the workspace settings page
# On the section "Apps and Features" select "Smart Mirroring"
# Click on "Set up Mirror"
# Follow the [Set up Bitbucket Smart Mirroring|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/set-up-bitbucket-smart-mirroring/] documentation, that will fail to show the personal workspace as an option on step 5 -> "Connect the mirror to your Atlassian account"

h3. Expected Results

Have all workspaces that the user has administrator access to being listed as options to set up the "Smart mirror"

h3. Actual Results

Currently, only shared/team workspaces are listed as options to set up the "Smart mirror"

h3. Workaround

# Create a shared/team workspace
# Upgrade the shared/team workspace to premium 
#* Transfer the repositories from the "personal workspace" to the new "shared/team workspace"
# Follow our documentation [Set up Bitbucket Smart Mirroring|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/set-up-bitbucket-smart-mirroring/] to set up the integration between Bitbucket Cloud and Server
fields.summary: Smart mirror not available to Personal Workspaces
Cannot create repository in another user's personal workspace via API, but can do so via Bitbucket UI

fields.description:
the recent reviewers section of a pull request will often get populated with people I only ever wanted to add to one pull request, clogging up my recent reviewers.

 

Having an option to remove people that I likely won't include on future pull requests would help my workflow greatly.

 

alternatively, a "favorite reviewers" section would be a neat addition.
fields.summary: allow removal of recent reviewers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When searching for a branch, Bitbucket only displays 25 results which means if the result you are looking for is after the 25th result even after using filters, you won't be able to pick it.

The list that is provided comes in the same order as git branch command and does not provide exact matches or close matches first.

@croos The main branch dropdown has the same bug, it only displays 25 results. Even after using filters, you won't be able to pick it. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Creating a branch
 ## In a repository with 26 branches or more, open the branches page
 ## Click on *Create Branch*
 ## On the *From branch* dropdown, specify the branch that you want as parent. Note only 25 branches are displayed. This is not possible to create a branch from a parent if that is parent branch is not in the list of 25 branches
 # Setting the Main branch
 ## Go to *Repository settings* in a repository with 26 branches or more
 ## Expand *ADVANCED* button on the right side
 ## Click on *Main branch* dropdown to select the Main branch
 ## Specify branch to be setup as main branch, note 25 branches are displayed. This is not possible to setup the main branch if that is not listed in the list of 25 branches

h3. Expected Results

If a filter matches the exact branch, the branch would be displayed.
h3. Actual Results

Searching for a branch using a pattern, if its not listed in the top 25 results, the branch won't be displayed.
h3. Workaround

*While searching for the branch in a Create branch page*
   As a workaround, it is possible to create a branch based on another branch locally and then push the new branch to Bitbucket.
 *While searching for the branch in setting the main branch*
   As a workaround, use the old view of the page by adding _*spa=0*_ at the end of the URL. For example: [https://bitbucket.org/]<repo_owner>/<repo_slug>/admin?spa=0. You should be able to get list of all branches matching the pattern.
fields.summary: Searching for a branch on Create Branch or on Setting the Main branch does not pull best/exact matches first

fields.description:
We have a known issue where you cannot open a Jira issue using safari with "Prevent Cross-Site cookies" enabled.

This is documented on https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/reference-issues-in-your-development-work/

 !Screen Shot 2020-08-25 at 09.05.56.png|thumbnail! 

We should be able to put a more clear message regarding the "Cross-site cookies" or saying that user can open in a new tab.
fields.summary: Improve error message when trying to open a Jira issue link using Safari
2.0 API for archiving repositories.

fields.description: Currently there's no synchronisation mechanism between Trello and Bitbucket issues. I'd like to just have a Kanban board view of the issues that allows me to see what's happening for the upcoming milestone. I don't need Trello, and since it's not integrated with Bitbucket, it doesn't do me any good.
fields.summary: Provide a Kanban board for Bitbucket Issues

fields.description: Currently the only way you have of categorising issues is by Component, or Milestone. It would be great if we could categorise issues in more ways using tags. This would allow us to group issues by story or feature, or
fields.summary: Add Support for Taggable Issues

fields.description:
The typical workflow that we would like to see would include the following steps:
 # New
 # Open
 # Code Complete
 # Integration Testing Complete
 # Confirmed
 # Closed
fields.summary: Add support for customisable workflows

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The [/2.0/repositories/<workspaceandreposlug>/pullrequests/<id>/patch|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests/%7Bpull_request_id%7D/patch] API call fails, if the source branch is originating from a fork repository, where the caller doesn't have permission. In case the caller access the PR via the UI, the caller can see the diffs

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Fork a repository to user A, owned by a "team" Workspace
 # Do some change and create a PR for that change heading to the original repository
# Do the following call as user B: 
--X GET https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/owner/repo/pullrequests/id/patch
h3. Expected Results
It creates a patch text file
h3. Actual Results
Fails with: 
{"type": "error", "error": {"message": "You do not have permission to view one or more of the repositories in this diff"}}
h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The repositories/pullrequests/<id>/patch API call fails, if the source branch is originating from a fork repository, where the caller doesn't have permission

fields.description:
We run UI end-to-end testing on bitbucket, and for every build, we upload images to the Download section so we can analyze if things went wrong.

However, the files are kept there forever if we don't manually delete them. It would be nice to delete them automatically after a while, like setting an expiration time at the time the upload.
fields.summary: Expiration time for downloads

fields.description:
It has been requested to sync Projects between Bitbucket Cloud and JIRA Cloud when the two are integrated: when someone creates e.g. a Project in Bitbucket Cloud, then create automatically a Project in JIRA.

If an Issue tracker is enabled for a Bitbucket Cloud repo, and there are Components and Versions defined, then sync those also with JIRA: create automatically those Components and Versions for the JIRA Project with the same name as the Project this repo belongs to in Bitbucket.

The reason this has been asked is because at the moment users have to create separate projects, components and versions on both platforms.

This has been asked in the following Community post:
* https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Is-there-a-way-I-could-see-the-projects-etc-from-my-bitbucket/qaq-p/1455485?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=immediate_general_reply&utm_content=topic
fields.summary: Sync Projects, Components and Versions between JIRA and Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description:
Add IP whitelisting feature for Access keys(added to a repository) separately, to allow specify allowed IPs/IP ranges for specific Access keys.
To keep the usual way of working for usual users (team members), but limit
access for keys with specific IPs of team's build machines/internal secured
network.
fields.summary: IP whitelisting for each access key

fields.description:
It will best to give admin the access to limit which user/group to have the ability to delete Pull Request comment.

This will allow admin to keep track of the existing comments within the Pull Request
fields.summary: Option for admin to restrict PR comment deletion

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
File download from /download using API return Content-Encoding: as None in the header

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Download any files from https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/<workspace>/<repositorie>/downloads/
# Check the header

h3. Expected Results
According to the RFC. (Reference https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-3.1.2.2\). The header should be returning an "Identity" header if no encoding is required
h3. Actual Results
Content-Encoding: as None in the header is return

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: File download from /download using API return Content-Encoding: as None in Header

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Markdown quote blocks are rendered with double-quotes. Also, a line break is added if the line wraps.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Markdown file with the below content

{code:java}
This is a sample markdown quote
> This is a test quote

Second quote
> Contains the initial defination of the variables before the environmant variables are applied via the pipeline. Backend is currently module{code}
h3. Expected Results

!image-2020-08-21-23-12-51-255.png|width=482,height=333!
h3. Actual Results

!image-2020-08-21-23-18-02-151.png|width=666,height=161!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Markdown quoted text is rendered with double quotes

fields.description:
When 'Merge checks' are enforced, users are prevented from merging their pull requests unless they're meeting all the criteria.

As an admin, I'd like the option to bypass merge checks in some scenarios.

Other services like Github and Gitlbab already provide this option, it would be useful to have it in Bitbucket, too.

Attached an example of this feature in Github.
fields.summary: As an admin, I'd like the ability to bypass merge checks

fields.description:
Currently, it's possible to use the following API endpoint to create new access/deploy keys to a specified repository:
https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/deploy-keys
This can be done through OAuth as well.

If using OAuth, the deploy keys created through this endpoint will be associated with the OAuth consumer that was used for authentication.

Whenever the OAuth consumer access scope changes, the OAuth consumer will be re-created instead of edited, and the previous OAuth consumer will be deleted, which means that any associated deploy keys will be deleted together with it.

This behavior is undocumented on https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/deploy-keys. This feature request is to update the documentation to explain this behavior.
fields.summary: Update deploy keys api documentation - OAuth scope changes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The [API documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/commit/%7Bcommit%7D/reports/%7BreportId%7D#put] about Reports API and [Code Insights example document|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/code-insights/] don’t provide enough information about the DURATION field in the JSON data.

The value passed for the DURATION field is in milliseconds but this information is not mentioned in the documentation and is not clear to the customers.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Check [API documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/commit/%7Bcommit%7D/reports/%7BreportId%7D#put] for Reports API or [Code Insights example document|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/code-insights/]

h3. Expected Results

The [API documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/commit/%7Bcommit%7D/reports/%7BreportId%7D#put] for Reports API and [Code Insights example document|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/code-insights/] should provide clarity about the DURATION field
h3. Actual Results

The [API documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/commit/%7Bcommit%7D/reports/%7BreportId%7D#put] for Reports API and [Code Insights example document|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/code-insights/] doesn't provide clarity about the DURATION field
h3. Workaround

Please provide value for the DURATION field in milliseconds and not in seconds
fields.summary: Unclear Information about DURATION field in Reports API documentation

fields.description:
We would like to have the Personal workspaces flagged differently from team/shared workspaces as, currently, it is not possible for us to identify what is a personal workspace or a team/shared workspace as both look the same on the UI.
This generates the following issues:
# Add-ons -> Some are personal workspaces exclusive
# Management -> If the account/workspace owner deactivate/delete his/her Atlassian account, his/her Bitbucket account will also be unavailable (while these changes do not affect shared/team workspaces)
# Upgrade -> Since it is not possible to administrate another user persona workspace, we are not able to upgrade/downgrade it as needed. 

eg. 

 !image-2020-08-20-10-45-20-052.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve workspace identification

fields.description: Allow cherry picking after a Pull Request is merged so the same commit can be cherry-picked and a PR is raised for other branches.
fields.summary: Git Cherry-pick On Pull Requests

fields.description:
Sometimes our computer is running a lot of services/applications when doing development, while we raising a PR, if the *automatically loaded destination* branch is not what we wanted *and* has very large difference to the *from branch,* it takes few seconds even 10+ seconds before i can even get to choose the destination which i want, it creates a bad use experience in this scenario and make user frustrated.

Hope this feature can be totally removed.
fields.summary: Automatically loading destination branch/diff when raising a PR

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the window size of the browser is reduced to 1100 pixels in width. The horizontal scrolling function ceases to scroll completely only for the pipelines overview page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Access the repository with pipelines
 # Step 2 Reduce the screen size to 560x1100 pixels
 # Step 3 Try to scroll the screen horizontally

h3. Expected Results

Should scroll irrespective of the page and size. As the other pages scroll without any issues.
h3. Actual Results

The scrolling doesn't work as expected for size set to 1100 pixels in width

!image-2020-08-20-17-03-07-703.png!
h3. Workaround

Set window to default for pipelines UI
fields.summary: Bitbucket Pipelines Scrolling issues at screen width set to 1100 pixels

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Bug Fix Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

When you try to create a user group, Bitbucket only looks up ASCII characters to detect duplication.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a group named "2020-あいうえお"
 # Try creating a group named "2020-かきくけこ"
 # Notice the error message below:

{code:none}
A group with that name already exists.
{code}

 !Screen Shot 2020-08-20 at 17.10.13.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-08-20 at 17.09.35.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

Bitbucket looks up UTF-8 characters.

h3. Actual Results

You will see an error below:

{code:none}
A group with that name already exists.
{code}


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. 
You only have to use ACSII characters.
fields.summary: Take account of multibyte texts in the uniqueness of group names

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

LFS enabled repository cloned in Bitbucket Pipeline doesn't have write access for others on .git/lfs and it's children directories. With no write access on the .git/lfs directory, the non-root user is unable to perform Git push operations in the repository. Git operation works fine in the repository in the Pipeline if the root user performs the operation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run Pipeline in LFS enabled repository 
 # Make some changes in the repository and push the changes using any non-root user 

h3. Expected Results

The push should happen without any issue 
h3. Actual Results

The user receives the following error in the log:
{noformat}
Error cleaning LFS object: open /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/.git/lfs/tmp/<ID>: permission denied
error: packet write failed
error: external filter 'git-lfs filter-process' failed
fatal: ****: clean filter 'lfs' failed
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Provide 777 permission on .git/lfs directory recursively before pushing the changes
fields.summary: Non root user is unable to push changes in LFS enabled repository in Pipeline

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While adding more than 10 access keys on a repository, you are only able to see 10 of the latest and you are unable to browse them.
 Without being able to browse them, you cannot delete or view old ssh keys information without deleting the ones that are displayed at the top, as an example.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add 11 ssh keys on the repository settings "Access key" page
 # Leave the page (e.g. go to the "Repository Details" page)
 # Go back to the "Access key" page and notice only 10 keys are displayed.

h3. Expected Results

The page would display all SSH keys or provide a way to browse them through different pages
h3. Actual Results

Only the latest 10 results are displayed.
h3. Workaround

As a workaround for now you can use the following Bitbucket API to retrieve all the access keys associated with the repository - 
{code:java}
 curl -u username:password -X GET https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/workspace/reposlug/deploy-keys/ {code}
Use your BItbucket account and the password to specifying the credentials. If you are using SSO or 2FA for the authentication then use the App password. You can create the App password from [this|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/app-passwords/] link. Use [this|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/deploy-keys] link to get more information about the above API.

Once you have the list of access keys from the previous command, you can delete the keys with the following API call:
{code:java}
 curl -u username:password -X DELETE https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/workspace/reposlug/deploy-keys/key_code{code}
Use [this|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/deploy-keys/%7Bkey_id%7D#delete] link to get more information about the above API.
fields.summary: Adding 11 access keys on a repository only displays the latest 10 added

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if you add the same user on different workspaces, they will be billed per workspace.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be good to have per account billing instead of per workspace billing. This would allow the customers to have multiple workspaces associated with an account, and then have the billing plan associated with this account (instead of the workspace).
fields.summary: Add the possibility to have per account billing instead of per workspace billing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The /2.0/workspaces endpoint for the Bitbucket rest API is returning only workspaces where the user making the API call has Admin or Collaborative team access, but it is not returning any workspace where the user has a group or direct repo access.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Workspace A and grant user workspace Admin or Collaborative access;
 # Create Workspace B and grant user direct repo access;
 # User makes GET request for api.bitbucket.or/2.0/workspaces endpoint.

h3. Expected Results

The request should return both workspaces, A and B.
h3. Actual Results

The request returns only Workspace A.
h3. Workaround

The user will be able to see both workspaces by accessing bitbucket.org UI.

There are no current workarounds to get the same information through the API.
fields.summary: Workspaces API doesn't return workspaces where the user has group or direct repo access

fields.description:
Workspace permissions are not very intuitive. Giving someone admin permissions to the workspace doesn't allow them to create repositories within that workspace, for example. For that, the admin will need to go to User Groups and select separate permissions for that. 

It's not clear at first sight that a workspace admin will have limited scope.
fields.summary: Make workspace permissions more intuitive

fields.description:
Hi,

I am a user on both Github and Bitbucket. Github has a corporate supported CLI ( command line interface ) called "gh". Does Bitbucket have one too? The reason I ask is that I see many user projects on ( strangely ) Github like martiis/bitbucket-cli, iansinnott/bitbucket-cli.
Instead of user's contributions I am interested in a cli that Bitbucket provides and supports.

If not, please explain your reasoning as well. 

Thank you,
fields.summary: Does Bitbucket have a corporate supported CLI like Github's gh

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After a change to the {{/2.0/repositories/\{workspace}/\{repo_slug}/pullrequests/\{pull_request_id}/patch}} endpoint, some users are incorrectly unable to use the this endpoint as they do not have explicit permissions to one or more of the repositories in the given pull request.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a PR that the user has access to, but does not have explicit access to one of the repositories the pull request is from/to.
 # Send a GET request using the [patch endpoint for a pull request|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests/%7Bpull_request_id%7D/patch].
 # Check the response.

h3. Expected Results
User can get the patch from the specified pull request.

h3. Actual Results
User is returned the following 403 error: "You do not have permission to view one or more of the repositories in this diff", and cannot get the patch from the pull request.

h3. Workaround
Have a PR that the user has access to, but does not have explicit access to one of the repositories the pull request is from/to.
fields.summary: Using the pullrequests/pullrequest_id/patch API fails without explicit permissions

fields.description:
Folks,

 

I've been a big fan of Atlassian products for years, and as a developer, I've always preferred the Bitbucket product over github. I would use both in the free account capacity here...but recently, I've hit a limit with Bitbucket of only being able to share repositories with a maximum of 5 users. I received the following email:

!image-2020-08-17-14-10-11-841.png|width=409,height=440!

 

I then checked out what github's free account has to offer:

!image-2020-08-17-14-11-35-192.png|width=214,height=412!

 

Seems like Bitbucket is lagging on the developer/free offering, and as inconvenient it is for me to move all of my code repositories off of Bitbucket and onto github, it seems like it is the logical thing to do to meet my needs.

 

If you have any response to this, short term, that would allow me to continue to use Bitbucket and be able to collaborate with more than 5 users, please let me know - otherwise, I hope you consider this feedback for the long term otherwise you will lose a lot of developer market share to github.

 

Thank you for your time.
fields.summary: Max limit on collaborators for free accounts

fields.description:
While merging changes to a branch, we would like Bitbucket Pipelines to identify that there are new commits done to it (new HEAD) and, if there is a build "In Progress", to stop it, in order to have only one build running in the referred branch.

This is necessary for us when:
# We do multiple commits/pushes successively
# We merge Pull Requests to the same target branch successively
fields.summary: Pipelines -> HEAD commit Build control

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Assume that you have a private repo, and a User Group named 'Developers' that has Write access to the repo.

If you create a branch permission for e.g. master branch on this repo, with Write access: None, users of the 'Developers' User Group will still be able to push tags on master or create a tag on a commit of master from UI.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a private Bitbucket repo
 # Push some commits to the repo
 # Create a User Group named 'Developers' in the workspace that owns the repo, and add some users
 # Grant to this User Group Write access to the repo
 # Create a branch permission in this repo for master branch, with Write access: None
 # One of the users that belongs to the 'Developers' user group tries to create a tag on a commit of master from Bitbucket UI, OR
 tries to push a tag in a commit of master

h3. Expected Results

The user is prevented from creating a tag via the UI and from pushing a tag on master
h3. Actual Results

The user can create a tag in a commit of master from the UI and can also push a tag on master
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Branch permissions don't prevent tag creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding 2 or more reviewers on branch permissions page distorts the other fields - Safari browser
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open "branch permissions" page on any repository 
 # Add 2 or more reviewers

h3. Expected Results:

          !image-2020-08-14-19-43-49-798.png|width=119,height=162!
h3. Actual Results

#   !image-2020-08-14-19-44-31-382.png|width=111,height=132!

*Workaround:*
Suggested customer to use Chrome/Firefox
fields.summary: Adding 2 or more reviewers on branch permissions page distorts the other fields - Safari browser
Add support for alternative pagination method on pullrequests/activity API endpoint

fields.description:
When adding a webhook that is not publicly available on the internet in Bitbucket, you get the following message:
Unexpected Value for URL

The suggestion here would be to explain that the hook URL that was added is not reachable, instead of this message.
fields.summary: Change invalid webhook message

fields.description: It would be great if the green check mark that appears at the top of the Pull Request when an user approves the PR could be replicated to all comments and sections the user avatar is displayed so that it lessen any confusion on whether that user approved the PR or not.
fields.summary: Have the approval green check in a Pull Request replicate to the user avatar in all sections within the PR

fields.description:
At this time, Bitbucket Cloud workspaces don't have an option to set the default Forking policy to be applied to new repositories. And, it is set to 'Allow only private forks':

!Screen Shot 2020-08-13 at 19.43.28.png|width=348,height=292!

It would be great to have this feature in place for users looking to have a consistency on Fork policy settings
fields.summary: Default Forking policy in workspace settings

fields.description:
Hello,

I just noticed the new "Load files individually" feature in the pull request screen and I was really excited about it until I noticed it was _files_ and not _commits_.

I'd love to see the same thing for commits, it would stimulate developers to create smaller commits dedicated to a single task (refacto, clean up, typo fix, feature code, etc) and help reviewers to better understand a pull request by reading it commit by commit.
fields.summary: Load commits individually
No alternative API endpoint for "../permissions/repositories/.." after deprecation of "Team" API endpoint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Admins are not being notified as expected when transferring repositories from one workspace to another.

This happens in 2 different scenarios...
 # Repository transferred from a TEAM workspace, to an Individual workspace - none of the admins of the target workspace are being notified, regardless of if there are 1 or more admins on the target workspace
 # Repository transferred from Individual workspace to TEAM workspace with _multiple_ admins - none of the admins of the target workspace are being notified. However if the target workspace only has *one* admin, then the admin receives an email

h3. Steps to Reproduce
h4. Scenario 1 - Transfer repository from Team workspace to Individual Workspace
 # Create a repository on a team workspace
 # Transfer the repository to an individual workspace
 # Observe that the admin(s) of individual workspace do not receive repository transfer request email

h4. Scenario 2 - Transfer repository from Individual workspace to TEAM workspace with multiple admins
 # Create a Team workspace with multiple admins
 # Create a repository on an individual workspace
 # Transfer that repository to the Team workspace with multiple admins
 # Observe that the admins of the Team workspace do not receive any repository transfer request emails

h3. Expected Results

The admin(s) of the target workspace in both scenarios should receive a repository transfer request email so they can accept it.
h3. Actual Results

None of the admin(s) on the target workspace in both scenarios receive a repository transfer request email.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Admin(s) of target workspace are not being notified when transferring repositories

fields.description:
When developers edit different folders within on repo, there should be folder level rules which dictate who is added as a Pull Request approver.

For instance I am a developer, who has edited
{code:java}
/lib/login/foo.js
and
/app/xyz/bar.js{code}

*/lib/login* has folder based ownership for JENNY

*/app/xyz* has folder based ownership for MELINDA

JENNY and MELINDA should both be added as reviewers on my PR.
fields.summary: Folder Based Pull Request Reviewers

fields.description:
At this time, the Bitbucket Cloud repository allows 50 deployment environments. Few users have a use case that requires more deployment environments than this limit. 

This feature request has been created to better understand the use case and the number of customers impacted by the current limit.
fields.summary: Increase deployment environment limit to 100

fields.description:
As per [this deprecation notice|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/bitbucket-api-teams-deprecation/] the {{/2.0/teams/}} endpoints in the API will be removed on 14 October 2020.

The notice says they have been replaced by {{/2.0/workspaces/}} endpoints, but those don’t include {{/pipelines_config/variables}} so users will have no way to get or set workspace variables via REST.

To preserve REST access to workspace variables we need the missing endpoint added.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Change integrations to use {{/2.0/workspaces/\{id}/pipelines_config/variables/}}
instead of {{/2.0/teams/\{id}/pipelines_config/variables/}}

h3. Expected Results
Requests and responses work as before.

h3. Actual Results
Requests return 404 Not Found.
fields.summary: Add pipeline config variables to v2 workspaces API resource

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If login session expired, Bitbucket Cloud doesn't redirect to login page while user trying to access Workspace's Project page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open incognito browser
# Access the private project with the URL:
_Sameple: https://bitbucket.org/<WorkspaceID>/workspace/projects/<Project-KEY>_
# Bitbucket Cloud will prompt with "That link has no power here" page without any redirection to the login page

h3. Expected Results
It's expected that the Private Project page will work the same as the private repository, which will check the login session and redirect to the login page.

h3. Actual Results
The private project page shows "That link has no power here" page instead of redirecting to the login page
 
h3. Workaround
From the "That link has no power here" page:
# Click the "dashboard" text to allow Bitbucket Cloud to redirect to login page
# Once it's logged in, user can try to access the Project page again
fields.summary: Accessing Workspace's private Project page does not redirect to login page

fields.description:
The email I get for a merged pull request only identifies the PR number and title. It would be really nice to also show the name of the branch that was merged.

Thanks.
fields.summary: More info in Pull Request Merged email

fields.description:
h4. Summary:

Error encountered with workspaces or any account changes has a generic error message stating "{color:#de350b}Something went wrong{color}".
This is not quite informative enough for the users and is unaware of what might have gone wrong with the platform or their account.

e.g. When updating your workspace ID to something and ID which is already in use, the {color:#de350b}Something went wrong{color} message appears, instead of simply saying that this ID is already took.
fields.summary: Improved error messaging for Workspace error

fields.description:
*As reviewer*

I want to comment a file or line and I would the developer to let me know if the comment has been considered and fixed

*As developer*

I want indicate to the reviewer that my changes is solving the comment by mark the it as resolved

(+) The desired comments (to fix) could be identified with an option, blocking the ability to merge if they are not fixed. When that kind of comment is added, a task could be created automatically (may the title could be truncate in the tasks list and link the associated comment)
fields.summary: Ability to mark comment as resolved

fields.description:
As per https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/workspaces/%7Bworkspace%7D/hooks, Bitbucket Cloud does have the ability to add webhooks to a workspace through the API.

This ability is locked to the API only, however, and it would be great to be able to manage these webhooks through the user interface in Bitbucket Cloud
fields.summary: Add workspace-wide webhooks to UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In some circumstances, moved / renamed files appear to be treated as added/subtracted. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This can't always be reproduced. 
 # Move or rename a file in a pull request
 

h3. Expected Results
The file is represented  as moved or renamed

h3. Actual Results
See that file as an 'add' and a 'deleted' in the PR


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Renaming / moving files occasionally appears as a add/subtraction

fields.description:
When creating a PR, would be nice to have as target another PR. 

If the target PR get merged (lets say, in develop/master), then the target is updated to point to the same target.

Would also be nice to add a merge check that prevent to merge into another PR.

The idea is that sometimes there are cumulative PR, so you want to see the difference between each other, but also I would like to make sure they wont get merged together ending up in a huge PR, but instead force to start from the nearest to develop.
fields.summary: diff against PR

fields.description:
This task takes too many steps.

The corresponding help points to a non-existent button at the bottom of the page.
fields.summary: Obscure & convoluted way to delete a repo + outdated help info

fields.description: At this moment, only failed Pipelines builds trigger notifications. It would be good to have an option to have notifications for successful Pipelines builds too.
fields.summary: Email notification for pipeline successful builds
